entry.title: Controversial Armenian politician under detention in Las Vegas

media:group.media:title: Controversial Armenian politician under detention in Las Vegas
media:group.media:description:
üìç Controversial Armenian video blogger and politician Vardan Ghukasyan was detained in the United States by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and is currently being held at the Henderson Detention Center in Las Vegas. üìç Armenia‚Äôs Foreign Affairs Ministry issued a statement today, drawing the international community's attention to the plight of Armenian prisoners of war, hostages, and other detained persons in Azerbaijan, describing their ongoing trials as staged as well as pointing out procedural violations and torture. üìç Kocharyan's revisionist press conference: https://youtu.be/coDvo7A889Q?si=QbVJk_w1MvCABOL1

media:group.media:title: A winter wonderland of books #shorts
media:group.media:description:
Book lovers in Yerevan braved a February winter storm to attend the Bookuboran Litfest, its name a play on words for the Armenian word for blizzard. Organized by the Woods Center, it was a great opportunity for learning and broadening one‚Äôs intellectual horizons.

entry.title: Protests in Yerevan demand action for Armenian prisoners held by Azerbaijan #shorts

media:group.media:title: Protests in Yerevan demand action for Armenian prisoners held by Azerbaijan #shorts
media:group.media:description:
Protests in Yerevan today demanded the immediate release of Armenian prisoners detained in Azerbaijan. While top Armenian officials had previously remained silent on the issue, saying it could result in harm to the detainees, they have begun speaking out as well, with the Foreign Ministry releasing a statement today condemning the unfair trials and human rights violations.

entry.title: Civil society warns constitutional overhaul could deepen Armenia‚Äôs polarization

media:group.media:title: Civil society warns constitutional overhaul could deepen Armenia‚Äôs polarization
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia and Azerbaijan continue to be deadlocked over two provisions of a draft normalization deal, with international lawsuits and border monitors still at issue. üìç Several Armenian NGOs including the Armenian General Benevolent Union issued a joint appeal urging an end to Azerbaijan‚Äôs political persecution of Ruben Vardanyan, as his health declines. üìç Constitutional law expert Armen Mazmanyan warns CivilNet about the ongoing proposal to replace Armenia's constitution, saying it could deepen the country's already severe social polarization.

media:group.media:title: Kocharyan's revisionist press conference
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian delves into two major developments in the region. He examines the ongoing show trials being conducted by the Azerbaijani regime against prominent Armenians, particularly the hunger strike by Ruben Vardanyan against the flagrant violations of his right to a fair trial. Eric also delves intoformer Armenian President Robert Kocharyan's lengthy press conference, in which he made excuses for his close friend Vladimir Putin's behavior and blamed Armenia for Russia's betrayal and abdication of its treaty responsibilities towards its ally.

media:group.media:title: Ruben Vardanyan forced to attend court sessions in Baku despite worsening health condition #shorts
media:group.media:description:
Former Artsakh cabinet leader Ruben Vardanyan‚Äôs health has sharply declined a week into his hunger strike, yet Azerbaijan is still forcing him to attend court hearings, his international lawyer Jared Genser said yesterday. He urged world leaders and Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan to condemn the trial against Vardanyan and other Armenians as unlawful.
